timeline.message:
Finalize MetricData definition

Signed-off-by: Bogdan Drutu <bogdandrutu@gmail.com>

Finalize MetricData definition

Signed-off-by: Bogdan Drutu <bogdandrutu@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText: How about we call this LongPoint, as that will be much more clear to most java developers.
timeline.author: jkwatson
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -34,33 +37,120 @@ /** * Returns the {@link Descriptor} of this metric. * - * @return the {@code MetricDescriptor} of this metric. + * @return the {@code Descriptor} of this metric. * @since 0.1.0 */ public abstract Descriptor getDescriptor(); /** - * Returns the start epoch timestamp in nanos of this {@code Instrument}, usually the time when - * the metric was created or an aggregation was enabled. + * Returns the data {@link Int64Point}s for this metric, or {@code null} if the {@link + * Descriptor.Type} of the metric does not generate this type of points. * - * @return the start epoch timestamp in nanos. - * @since 0.1.0 + *

Only one type of points are available at any moment for a {@link MetricData}. + * + * @return the data {@link Point}s for this metric, or {@code null} if this type of points are not + * accepted. + * @since 0.3.0 */ - public abstract long getStartEpochNanos(); + @Nullable + public abstract Collection getInt64Points(); /** - * Returns the the epoch timestamp in nanos when data were collected, usually it represents the - * moment when {@code Instrument.getData()} was called. + * Returns the data {@link DoublePoint}s for this metric, or {@code null} if the {@link + * Descriptor.Type} of the metric does not generate this type of points. * - * @return the epoch timestamp in nanos. - * @since 0.1.0 + *

Only one type of points are available at any moment for a {@link MetricData}. + * + * @return the data {@link Point}s for this metric, or {@code null} if this type of points are not + * accepted. + * @since 0.3.0 + */ + @Nullable + public abstract Collection getDoublePoints(); + + static MetricData createWithInt64Points( + Descriptor descriptor, Collection int64Points) { + Descriptor.Type type = Utils.checkNotNull(descriptor, "descriptor").getType(); + Utils.checkState( + type == Descriptor.Type.NON_MONOTONIC_INT64 || type == Descriptor.Type.MONOTONIC_INT64, + "Incompatible points type with metric type."); + return new AutoValue_MetricData( + descriptor, Utils.checkNotNull(int64Points, "longPoints"), null); + } + + static MetricData createWithDoublePoints( + Descriptor descriptor, Collection doublePoints) { + Descriptor.Type type = Utils.checkNotNull(descriptor, "descriptor").getType(); + Utils.checkState( + type == Descriptor.Type.NON_MONOTONIC_DOUBLE || type == Descriptor.Type.MONOTONIC_DOUBLE, + "Incompatible points type with metric type."); + return new AutoValue_MetricData( + descriptor, null, Utils.checkNotNull(doublePoints, "doublePoints")); + } + + @Immutable + abstract static class Point { + Point() {} + + /** + * Returns the start epoch timestamp in nanos of this {@code Instrument}, usually the time when + * the metric was created or an aggregation was enabled. + * + * @return the start epoch timestamp in nanos. + * @since 0.3.0 + */ + public abstract long getStartEpochNanos(); + + /** + * Returns the the epoch timestamp in nanos when data were collected, usually it represents the + * moment when {@code Instrument.getData()} was called. + * + * @return the epoch timestamp in nanos. + * @since 0.3.0 + */ + public abstract long getEpochNanos(); + } + + /** + * Int64Point is a single data point in a timeseries that describes the time-varying values of a + * int64 metric. + */ + @Immutable + @AutoValue + public abstract static class Int64Point extends Point {

replies.bodyText: I would like to make a decision one way or the other. the protocol will use int64 and other languages will use int64 but I do see the confusion for Java devs.
replies.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText: My preference would be to call the class LongPoint and document the Int64 protocol information in the javadoc.
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: Can I do that in a separate PR?
replies.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText: @jkwatson if you agree with that please review/approve this PR.
replies.author: bogdandrutu
